Method Detail

createDirectory

public static java.io.File createDirectory(java.io.File theDirectory)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Create a valid directory from the given File

Parameters:
theDirectory - the directory to create
Returns:
the newly created directory
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the directory cannot be created

deleteRecursively

public static void deleteRecursively(java.io.File theFile)
                              throws java.io.IOException

Recursively deletes a directory and all its contents, if this a file, it will simply be deleted.

Be careful calling this, if any directory is a symlink, this could delete the contents of the linked directory.

Parameters:
theFile - the file or directory to recursively delete.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was an error while deleting

listFiles

public static java.util.List<java.io.File> listFiles(java.io.File theDirectory)
Recursively traverse the directory and all its sub directories and return a list of all the files contained within.

Parameters:
theDirectory - the start directory
Returns:
all files in the start directory and all its sub directories.

zipDirectory

public static void zipDirectory(java.io.File theDir,
                                java.io.File theOutputFile)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Zip the given directory.

Parameters:
theDir - the directory to zip
theOutputFile - the zip file to write to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an error while zipping the directory or while saving the results.

listFiles

public static java.util.List<java.io.File> listFiles(java.io.File theDirectory,
                                                     java.io.FileFilter theFilter)
Recursively traverse the directory and all its sub directories and return a list of all the files contained within. Only files which match the file filter will be returned.

Parameters:
theDirectory - the start directory
theFilter - the file filter to use.
Returns:
the list of files in the directory (and its sub directories) which match the file filter.

rotate

public static void rotate(java.io.File theFile)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Rotates a file. Moves the specified file to a new file in the same directory, the name of the new file is postfixed with the current date (YYYY-mm-dd). If this file exists, that file name is post-fixed . where number is continuously incremented counter until a unique file name is found.

Parameters:
theFile - the file name to be rotated
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be moved to the new location

copyDirectory

public static void copyDirectory(java.io.File theSource,
                                 java.io.File theDest)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException
